intro: Lastrea thibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan lastrea, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a glossy surface and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of pink and purple. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
